items.description: Apply EMA smoothing (span 5-10 days, Optuna-tunable) to raw options_risk_regime_prob output. This reduces stability from 0.1555 to below 0.15 threshold by dampening sharp HMM state transitions.
items.reason: Gate 2 stability fails by only 0.006 (0.1555 vs 0.15). EMA smoothing is the most direct fix with minimal risk to existing MAE performance. Cross-asset submodel had identical issue (stability 0.156) that smoothing would have addressed.

items.description: Add a second output column: options volatility trend z-score. Candidate signals (architect to choose): (a) GVZ rate-of-change z-score, (b) SKEW change z-score, (c) VIX term structure slope change. Must have VIF < 10 with smoothed regime_prob.
items.reason: Gate 2 MI fails by only 0.04pp (4.96% vs 5%). Reducing from 3 to 1 column lost MI (17.12% -> 4.96%). A single complementary directional signal should recover MI above 5% without reintroducing the noise from attempt 1's tail_risk_z and skew_momentum_z.
constraints: Second column must have standalone MI > 0.01

items.description: Optuna HPO for EMA span (5-20 days) and z-score normalization window (20-252 days) for the second column. Objective: maximize combined MI with gold returns.
items.reason: Previous attempts show that window parameters significantly affect stability and MI. Optuna should find the optimal balance.

previous_feedback.root_cause: Single column output has marginal MI (4.96%) and marginal stability (0.1555). Regime probability alone captures risk level but not direction. DA and Sharpe remain negative because the feature helps MAE (error reduction) but does not provide directional edge.
key_evidence: MI decreased from 17.12% (3 cols) to 4.96% (1 col) -- expected but now below threshold
Stability 0.1555 is inherent to raw HMM outputs (regime switches are abrupt)
DA improved from -1.05% (attempt 1) to -0.24% (attempt 2) -- trend is positive but still negative
MAE improvement is very strong: -0.1562 (15.6x threshold), consistent across 4/5 folds
Feature importance rank #2 at 7.55% -- highly valued by meta-model
anti_patterns: DO NOT use 3+ output columns -- attempt 1 proved this adds noise
DO NOT use raw (unsmoothed) HMM regime probabilities if stability > 0.15
DO NOT include tail_risk_z or skew_momentum_z -- low MI (0.002, 0.017) in attempt 1
what_worked: Dimensionality reduction from 3 to 1 column improved DA consistency (0/5 -> 3/5 folds)
HMM regime detection captures genuine risk structure (7.55% feature importance)
MAE improvement is robust across folds and time periods
